_comment: Pelican Panel Egg for Hytale Server (Pelican-Optimized Fork)
name: Hytale Server (Pelican)
author: scotthowson
description:
Production-ready Hytale server powered by scotthowson's Pelican-optimized fork.

‚ú® FEATURES:
‚Ä¢ Automatic server file downloads with smart update detection
‚Ä¢ Built-in CurseForge mod management
‚Ä¢ Automatic backups with configurable retention
‚Ä¢ Professional security defaults
‚Ä¢ Optimized for Pelican Panel (no config needed!)

üîê AUTHENTICATION REQUIRED (Two Steps):

STEP 1 - Downloader Auth (First Start Only):
  1. Start your server
  2. Watch console for device code URL
  3. Visit URL and enter the code
  4. Files download automatically
  5. Credentials saved for future starts

STEP 2 - Server Auth (After Server Boots):
  1. Open console
  2. Run: /auth persistence Encrypted
  3. Run: /auth login device
  4. Visit URL + enter device code
  5. If multiple profiles: /auth select <number>
  6. Verify: /auth status

‚úÖ After both steps, players can connect!

üåê Port: UDP 5520 (QUIC protocol)

Based on Hybrowse's excellent work: https://github.com/Hybrowse/hytale-server-docker

installation.script:
#!/bin/bash
set -e

cd /mnt/server

cat << 'EOF'

==========================================
  Hytale Server - Pelican Panel
==========================================

This egg uses scotthowson's Pelican-optimized
fork of the Hybrowse Docker image.

The image handles:
  ‚úì Automatic Hytale server file downloads
  ‚úì Smart update detection
  ‚úì CurseForge mod management (optional)
  ‚úì Automatic backups (optional)
  ‚úì Pelican Panel compatibility

Docker Image:
  ghcr.io/scotthowson/hytale-server-pelican:latest

GitHub:
  https://github.com/scotthowson/hytale-server-pelican

==========================================
  Installation Complete!
==========================================

Your server is ready to start.

==========================================
  AUTHENTICATION REQUIRED
==========================================

Hytale requires TWO authentication steps:

üìù STEP 1: Downloader Authentication
    (First Start Only)

  1. Start your server
  2. Watch the console output
  3. You'll see: "Please visit https://..."
     with a device code
  4. Open the URL in your browser
  5. Enter the device code
  6. Server downloads files automatically
  7. Credentials saved for future starts

üìù STEP 2: Server Authentication
    (After Server Boots)

  1. Once server fully boots, open console
  2. Run these commands:

     /auth persistence Encrypted
     /auth login device

  3. You'll see another URL + device code
  4. Visit URL and enter the code
  5. If multiple profiles:
     /auth select <number>
  6. Verify authentication:
     /auth status

‚úÖ After BOTH steps, players can connect!

==========================================
  Server Details
==========================================

Protocol: QUIC over UDP
Port: 5520 (must be UDP in Pelican)
Memory: Configure via variables below

Documentation:
  https://github.com/scotthowson/hytale-server-pelican
  https://github.com/Hybrowse/hytale-server-docker

==========================================

EOF

variables.name: Auto Download
variables.description: Automatically download Hytale server files on first run using the official Hytale Downloader. Requires device code authentication on first start (watch console).

variables.name: Auto Update
variables.description: Check for server updates on each startup. Only downloads when updates are available.

variables.name: Server Port
variables.description: UDP port for Hytale server (QUIC protocol). Must match your Pelican allocation.

variables.name: Max Memory
variables.description: Maximum JVM heap size (e.g., 4G, 8G, 16G). This is your server's main memory allocation.

variables.name: Min Memory
variables.description: Minimum JVM heap size. Usually set to same as max for consistent performance.

variables.name: Server Name
variables.description: Display name for your Hytale server.

variables.name: Max Players
variables.description: Maximum number of concurrent players.

variables.name: View Distance
variables.description: View distance in chunks (1 chunk = 32 blocks). Default: 12 chunks = 384 blocks. Higher = more RAM.

variables.name: Authentication Mode
variables.description: Server authentication. 'authenticated' requires valid Hytale account (recommended). 'unauthenticated' allows any username (testing only).

variables.name: Enable Backups
variables.description: Enable automatic world backups. Backups saved to /home/container/backups/

variables.name: Backup Frequency (Minutes)
variables.description: How often to create backups (in minutes). Only used if backups enabled.

variables.name: Backup Retention Count
variables.description: Max number of backup archives to keep. Older backups deleted. Only used if backups enabled.

variables.name: CurseForge Mods
variables.description:
Space or newline-separated list of CurseForge mod IDs or ID:FileID pairs.

Examples:
‚Ä¢ 123456 (latest version)
‚Ä¢ 123456:3456789 (specific file)
‚Ä¢ Multiple: 123456 234567 345678

Requires API key below.

variables.name: CurseForge API Key
variables.description:
Your CurseForge API key for mod downloads.
Get one at: https://console.curseforge.com/

Required if using CurseForge mods above.

variables.name: CurseForge Auto Update
variables.description: Automatically update CurseForge mods on server start.

variables.name: CurseForge Release Channel
variables.description: Which CurseForge release channel to use for mod updates.

variables.name: Disable Sentry
variables.description: Disable Sentry error reporting to Hypixel Studios. Enable for privacy.

variables.name: Enable AOT Cache
variables.description: Enable Ahead-of-Time compilation cache for faster startup. First start slower while cache generates. Recommended: auto

variables.name: Allow Self-Op
variables.description: Allow server owner to use /op command. Not recommended for production servers.

variables.name: Validate Assets
variables.description: Validate Assets.zip on startup. Increases startup time but ensures integrity.

variables.name: Debug Mode
variables.description: Enable debug logging. Useful for troubleshooting but very verbose.
